result.execSummary:
The defendant M L Powell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Armed Robbery with Use of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 12 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victims (person, property, residence or family).  Full compliance with all family court orders.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including psychological evaluation. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

Defendant M L Powell in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant M L Powell in custody.  Christopher Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Jane Slaght.
DAY TWO.
Oath #2 Given.
Preliminary instructions addressed. 
Opening statements.
State calls R.R., DSAT.
State calls K.S., DSAT.
Jury excused.
Defendant requests to be excused from the courtroom.
Court conducts a colloquy with Defendant regarding request to leave the courtroom.
Defendant chooses not to participate and leaves the courtroom.
Jury re-enters the courtroom and testimony continues.
State calls J.F., DSAT.
State moves exhibit 1 into evidence. BTC: rec'd & published.
Jury excused for break.
Defense raises competency issues.
BTC: Defendant is not incompetent. Trial will continue.

Defense objects.
BTC: Judicial notice taken.

State calls J.P., DSAT.

Jury excused for break.

State recalls Investigator Matson, DSAT.
Defense moves exhibit 22 into evidence. BTC: rec'd.
Stipulation regarding bond read into record.
State rests.
Jury breaks for lunch.
Jury instruction conference.
Defense moves to dismiss.
State objects.
BTC: Motion to dismiss is denied. 
Defendant stands mute on all questions regarding testifying today.
Defendant removed from the courtroom for the remainder of the proceedings.
Jury returns.
Defense rests.
Jury instructions read to Jurors.
Closing arguments
Alt. Juror chosen and excused.
Oath #3 given

Jurors excused.

Defense moves for Judgments of acquittals notwithstanding the verdict.

BTC: Judgment on the verdict. Order for PSI. Defendant to be held without bond pending sentencing.

Defendant M L Powell in court with attorney Joshua Hargrove.  Defendant M L Powell in custody.  W. Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.

BTC: Adjournment granted.   Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victims, JLF, RLR, JMP and KJS (person, property, residence or family).   You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
